1) Running command docker run -it -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /home/ubuntu/dir:/home/ubuntu/dir ojaswa1942/privado-cli-wrapper /home/ubuntu/dir
results in error - the input device is not a TTY hence remove i from -it

2) after removing -i from the above command, I got the error 
Status: Downloaded newer image for public.ecr.aws/privado/privado:latest
Received error: Error response from daemon: invalid mount config for type "bind": bind source path does not exist: /root/.privado/keys/user.key 

3) change directory to pwd --  -v $(pwd):$(pwd) ojaswa1942/privado-cli-wrapper:latest $(pwd)
again the same error persists.

4) without mounting the volume got the error - docker: Cannot connect to the Docker daemon at unix:///var/run/docker.sock. Is the docker daemon running?
hence mount volume in the run command itself

final command - docker run -t -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /root/.cache:/root/.cache -v /root/.privado:/root/.privado -v $(pwd):$(pwd) ojaswa1942/privado-cli-wrapper:latest --overwrite --upload $(pwd)


final file contents --

name: Java CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [ "master" ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ "master" ]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v2

      - name: Pull Docker Image
        run: docker pull ojaswa1942/privado-cli-wrapper:latest

      - name: Run Docker Container
        run: |
          docker run -t -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /root/.cache:/root/.cache -v /root/.privado:/root/.privado -v $(pwd):$(pwd) ojaswa1942/privado-cli-wrapper:latest --overwrite --upload $(pwd)
